comments.commentBody: Presumably the "dynasty" talk from Philadelphia writers has been silenced.  Giants vs. Rangers....great for baseball.

Another Cardiac 1 run win with several stroke moments, especially Bochy had me freaking out when he put Timmy the Freak in....do not do that again....pleaseThank You Uribe and Freddy and todos los Gigantes....more work next week with the hard hitting texans!

Pales in comparison to next post, which will be more valid comparison between Beltran and Ryan Howard, caught looking for last out NLCS. With Beltran and Howard the game was on the line. Also unlike Beltran, Howard and A-Rod have carried their teams to WS championships.
Now for the haters: All the talk of how fitting it was for A-Rod to make the last out reminds me of how Tampa Bay was touted and congratulated for their WS appearance (and loss) two years ago. Now they will lose key players to free agency and fade from view (Astros, Marlins, Indians, move over). I doubt one or two post-season appearances in the history of a franchise after decades of losing (yes, you too Texas) versus the Yankee model (for winning and profiting, gasp!, this is a business?) is really a great way to go.
Have a nice winter small-market cities (that don't mind collecting the payroll tax $$ the rich and well-run clubs pay, but don't really endeavor to spend that $$ on players and then watch their owners sell for mad profit) and enjoy this boring WS, we'll be back in it, or on the verge next year, providing you with a team to hate. (Hey Minny, your "professional impassivity" isn't netting you any post-season celebrating.) See you in NY for your X-mas shopping and a Broadway play.
Can someone tell Conan to get his blimp out to the West coast? Thanks!

You wrote:  "Years later, some of the Democrats on that all-male, all-white Senate Judiciary Committee told me they assumed there must have been a consensual romance between the boss and his subordinate".  I still think that and so do a lot of people.  There was no excuse for Hill behaving the way she did except for being a woman scorned.  Justice Thomas would never have been treated the way he was treated if he had White skin.
As an and admirer of French food and it's elegant understated fashion in clothes, allow me a further conceit:  Of with their heads!

Isn't that special? Even as Mrs. Thomas was collecting her big donor money in the kitchen, Mr. Thomas was in the library writing an opinion that ensured the big donors could maintain their anonymity. That's one way to stuff the family cookie jar.

Still, Mrs. Thomas was annoyed. She was especially annoyed when Jackie Calmes reported on the Thomas' secret piggy bank. Mrs. Thomas must have tossed & turned all night. (Contrary to speculation, Jake Tapper of ABC News, who has heard the audio tape, said she sounded "sober.") Lucky for Ms. Calmes that Mrs. Thomas didn't have her number. Too bad for Prof. Hill that her phone number was probably in the university directory.

Mrs. Thomas' crank call was likely perfectly legal. But what about her husband's perjury? In his testimony before the committee, Clarence Thomas unequivocally denied all of Ms. Hill's assertions. Are we really going to let that go? If you or I got a job based on a false resume, & our employer found out about it, we would be fired. The American people should fire Clarence Thomas. If he won't resign, the House should bring articles of impeachment.

Ms. McEwen, who is trying to sell a book, isn't the only witness. Ann Woolner of Bloomberg News reminds us that there were several others -- that we know about. Ellen Wells, Susan Hoerchner, John Carr & Joel Paul all testified at Thomas' hearing. Angela Wright & Rose Jourdain spoke to the committee staff. Lillian McEwen made herself available to the staff, but they chose not to interview her. In one way or another, these women & men all backed up Hill's assertions. Woolner thinks Ms. Thomas should have called some of these witnesses before she dialed Hill, which proved to be a big mistake.

Lying to the Congress is a crime punishable by up to five years in prison. And we have a Supreme Court Justice who, allegedly of course, ought to be in jail instead of sitting in judgment. But I'd suggest giving him the same deal Vice President Spiro Agnew got -- allow Thomas to resign. Soon, please.

Clarence Thomas' relationships with women were apparently highly problematic. That his wife brought them out for a new generation to titter over is one of life's fine ironies. Perhaps now he wishes he had been more honest with his wife. Had he been so, she would have resigned herself to collecting from fat cats & not felt the need to try to vindicate a man who appears to have done many women wrong. Especially Anita Hill.

The Constant Weader at www.RealityChex.com

If we lived in a normal republic and not the dysfunctional adolescent we have devolved into, both Scalia and Thomas would have been impeached by now. We have to make sure that another "strict-constructionist" corporate lackey republican does not take control of the White House in the forseeable future. One more vacancy on the Supreme Court will tip the 5-4 split to the Democrats' side. If Obama gets re-elected and has to make that appointment, the Senate Judiciary confirmation hearings will be a circus.

I know from my own experience and from what others say, that hate is more damaging to the one who hates than to the object of the hatred. But, I've been looking for an appropriate response to the outrageous and disgusting behavior of not only the Thomases but many in the far right and tea party leaders whose beliefs and intentions are not good for this country.

I'm not physically able to do much more than contribute money and vote consistent with my own principles which are way different than those I mentioned on the right.

But. like Juan Williams I have feelings of hatred and concern for the future but I don't get paid by NPR to publicly express those.

Give us a break, Maureen.  Even if Thomas enjoys erotica; so what?  Anita Hill did a dastardly thing for the pleasure of her political benefactors.  She should apologize, and people should give Ms Thomas recognition for being kind-hearted enough to give Ms Hill the chance.
I believed her then, and I believe her now. I had forgotten Joe Biden's role in the good ole boy choir that ran the hearings. Guess it ultimately served his career goals.

My colleague, Sukari Hardnett, also worked under Mr. Thomas before his confirmation to the Court, and confirmed that he was a well known hound dog. (You can Google it).

At his senate confirmation hearing, under oath, Mr. Thomas denied that he had EVER discussed the court's opinion in Roe v. Wade with anyone, even though he was attending Yale Law School at the time.

Every law student from 1971 forward has discussed Roe. Mrs. Thomas may be a boor. Mr. Thomas is a perjurer.

While I don't want to reopen that ugly Hill-Thomas Pandora's Box again I am curious about one thing--how and why has Ginny Thomas kept Anita Hill's phone number after all these years?

Anyhow what's done is done--Thomas has his lifetime Supreme Court appointment and Hill is a law professor. They've both moved on for better or worse and we should do the same. It's too late to rearrange the deck chairs on the Titanic now. Wistful thinking and playing woulda/shoula/coulda is a pointless exercise in futility.

How dare you judge Clarence Thomas, madam? He did not come from a comfortable, stable background like you, and the other men of the Court? Thomas overcame great difficulties to become a fine man and great jurist. He knew his Citizens dissent was just that, just like his race-sensitive dissents in Kelo and Black.

If you believe Thomas does not belong on the Court, you should also insist that Clinton should have lost the preseidency.

Lest anyone still entertain doubts about the Clarence Thomas psyche, it's recommended that they read his autobiography, a mewling descent into self-pity and aggrieved fantasy. It evinces an anger that is seemingly bottomless.

In the wake of both Citizens United and Bush V Gore, it's not just the Thomases who show supremely bad judgment, it is the entire Supreme Court. Lifelong elitists paid to opine for us all, and look what their opinions have wrought!

It's a court for and by the corporations of America.  We can expect no more and no less for the foreseeable future.   The disguise being worn by tea party members is like those of the king in the fairy tail -- none dared say what was obvious to all.

I found Judge McEwen extremely believable. It's a shame that Joe Biden decided to exclude her testimony. There is no doubt the Clarence Thomas is a sex addict, a fact no doubt known to his wife. Although Ginni's early morning call sounded accusatory and slightly inebriated, it was also like she said, "reaching out." My take is that Ginni believes, like McEwen and several others, that her husband had a relationship with Anita Hill and that Hill turned against him because of bitterness over that relationship. I do not believe Anita Hill told the whole truth in her testimony (her lie detector test seemed like a stunt), but the blame lies more with Biden, and most of all with Presidents Reagan (who appointed Thomas to EEOC) and George H.W. Bush (who appointed him to the bench despite the cloud over his character.)

Ginni Thomas, if you will,
Up and phoned Anita Hill.
The outcome? 'Tis understood,
Blabbed it to the Neighborhood!

Was it a head full of rocks
That opened Pandora's box?
Or an excess of strong Tea
Misdirected dear Ginni?

I think Joe Biden failed to do due diligence on this malefactor that now blots our Supreme Court. I blame him for Thomas's disgusting presence on the court. Have fun while billionaires bent on reducing their taxes buy our government out from underneath us. It is nearly certain that Thomas is benefiting personally from his vote on the decision to allow unlimited money into the political arena. It's gonna make him millions.

All it takes for evil to prevail is for good people to sit on their keisters and do nothing.

Christine O’Donnell may not believe in the separation of church and state, but the Supreme Court does not believe in the separation of powers.

I don't know how many liberals it takes to read the Constitution but there is NOTHING in the 1st amendment about separation of church and state. Keep passing along false stories and eventually someone will believe its true and its funny but the only ones that will spread these false hoods is the liberal media. Good job Ms.Dowd you've officially jumped the shark.

As an Irish Catholic, you have no idea how sad it makes me that Thomas is a product of a parochial education. He obviously harbors a lot of demons and I feel truly sorry for him. He's taken the gift he's been given from affirmative action and "pulled up the ladder" on the less fortunate that have followed him. How he sleeps at night, I'll never know.

During the first Bush administration Clarence Thomas committed perjury during his confirmation process. During the second Bush administration John Roberts committed perjury during his confirmation process. Neither of these men have been held accountable for their crimes against our laws or our constitution and they should be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.

I long for the day when my beloved Democratic party will stop accepting disingenuous answers under oath and hold republican’s feet to the fire. This process of accepting everything as “An interesting point of view” will be the death of the Democratic party. Have we no adults who know a lie when they hear one? Must everything be analyzed as if it is “ serious issue needing to be examined”? Are their no triers of facts able to Judge the truth? Nothing less than bullying their way through, daring you to call them out has been the avenue that has afforded these liars and crooks to gain a stranglehold of our government and allowed them to keep us from prospering. When I supported Mr. Obama, when I donated to Mr. Obama it was with a hope that he would lead the Democratic party forward with a clear eye toward condemning and convicting those who would obfuscate and determine to trick the American people into believing more of their lies. It was because I believed he would stand up and draw a line in the sand. Instead he has tried, on multiple occasion to “get along” with them. It took me over 50 years to learn to accept that some people just “are not that into you” and sincerely want to cause you harm.

I have developed a saying that I use when I find out people want to hurt me: I will prove to you that I love you by doing something for you the devil will never do: I am going to leave you alone! From that point on I no longer consider their opinions nor even acknowledge that they are still breathing. I move on! Mr. President PLEASE move on! We need help and we do not have time for your hopeful experiment with your lovely ideal wishes for American bipartisanship…We need help NOW! Move ON, Sir!
It's that pesky constitution rearing it's ugly head again. How dare the Senate be forced to approve a candidate for the Supreme Court! It clearly is his fault.

I was waiting for this column all week, since the news broke of the 7:30am call! I wasn't disappointed - though I hoped it would be one of the columns where Maureen Dowd imagined the conversation that could have taken place between Anita Hill and Ginni Thomas. I hope Thomas makes another call so Ms. Dowd can write another column about the riveting return of Anita Hill vs Clarence Thomas!
